result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Scott A. Hoffman in court with attorney Zachary Paul Glascock.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called at 4:39 pm and appearances given. Charges in this case are DRI into 13CF214
Hearing on September 26, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on June 1, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Attorney appeared by phone.  Deft does not appear.  Case called appearances given.  Court gives status of the cases.  Defense attorney addresses the court.  The attorney informs the court that the deft wants to proceed to trial on 13CF214.  Not willing to accept any offers from the State.  State is requesting an bench warrant due to the fact that he was told that he needed to be present.  Attorney informs the court that the deft was aware of the status hearing and was planning on being present. Court orders the bench warrant in all three cases.  Deft appeared at 8:30 am.  Court quashes the warrant before being issued.  The state requests that the other case gets moves to a #1 jury trial.  The State also informs the court that the offer was a one time offer and is now off the table.  Court grants the request of the State to make these cases a #2 for jury trial selection.
Status conference on April 27, 2017 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on May 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Zachary Glascock

Defendant Scott A. Hoffman in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to withdraw as counsel - Statements by Court - Public defender will not appoint a 4th attorney unless the court advises the Public Defenders Office to do so - Statements by defendant - Court grants motion for Attorney Goetz to withdraw - Court orders the Public Defenders office to appoint new counsel - This is the last time the court will allow the apointment of new counsel - Court will keep trial on at this time -Adjourned
